children.subject:
Are you declared? And by that I mean not declared as CS/EECS and the ilk.

If so, I had the same issue and was told by advising that the 'other declared majors' designation overrides my transfer student status. I'd email cs-advising if you're not declared though.

history.content:
As of 11:13 AM (April 27) the remaining seats in CS70 are:

308  Seats Reserved for Electrical Engineering & Computer Science, EECS/Materials Science & Engineering, and EECS/Nuclear Engineering Majors; and Undeclared Students in the College of Engineering
381  Seats Reserved for College of Letters & Sciences: Undeclared Freshman and Sophomore Students or New Transfer Students

So you weren't able to join right away most likely because you have junior standing and aren't CS declared (assuming junior, since you said you're a transfer student). The seat restriction is due to the fact that CS70 is a major pre-requisite that is generally taken prior to junior year so the seats are prioritized for fresh/sophomores. If you are declared CS, then I would definite email cs-advising ASAP to figure out a solution

My advice would to be to stick on the waitlist since usually a good number of students drop CS70, and these seat requirements will usually be lifted later on in enrollment.

My advice would to be to stick on the waitlist since usually a good number of students drop CS70, and these seat requirements will usually be lifted later on in enrollment

I am a transfer student trying to enroll in CS 70 but it says I am not allowed to due to seat restrictions so I am waitlisted for the class. According to this, https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/cs/degree-reqs/enrollment-policy , transfer students should be able to phase 1 CS 70 since its a lower division cs course. Has there been a mistake? Should I be able to phase 1 CS 70?
history.subject: CS 70 Phase 1 problem
